metadata.title: CVE-2023-6865 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
`EncryptingOutputStream` was susceptible to exposing uninitialized data.This issue could only be abused in order to write data to a local diskwhich may have implications for private browsing mode. This vulnerabilityaffects Firefox ESR < 115.6 and Firefox < 121.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-6865` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 121.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 121.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 121.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '121.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
